body_content.explanation: the skill or activity of getting information from books:
examples: Reading and tennis are my favourite pastimes.
The diaries make good (bedtime) reading (= are good to read (in bed at night)).
These books are compulsory/required reading for students of architecture.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when something written, especially a work of literature, is spoken to an audience:
examples: The society often arranges poetry readings and musical evenings.

body_content.explanation: the way in which you understand something:
examples: My reading of the situation is that John wanted any excuse to resign.

body_content.explanation: In a parliament, a reading of a new law is one of the stages of discussion before it is approved:
examples: The Housing Bill was given its second reading in Parliament today.

body_content.explanation: the number or amount that a piece of measuring equipment shows:
